meanings.definition: Capable of being sanctioned or approved
meanings.sent1: The proposal was clearly sanctionable by the committee.
meanings.sent2: The school's new dress code was easily sanctionable by the principal.
meanings.sent3: The idea of having a pizza party every day might be sanctionable by the students!
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was so impressive that it was almost sanctionable by the art community.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors of the sunset made it a sanctionable sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: The criminal's actions were undeniably sanctionable by the law.
meanings.sent2: Repeated tardiness to work could be sanctionable by the employer.
meanings.sent3: His constant dad jokes were almost sanctionable by his friends!
meanings.sent4: The reckless driver's behavior was so dangerous that it was almost sanctionable by fate.
meanings.sent5: The student's plagiarism was a clear example of sanctionable academic misconduct.
